intro: Disterepta pilosa, commonly known as the hairy disterepta, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow in color. Disterepta pilosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
